fhir:human.value: A defined code system (if present) SHALL have a different identifier to the value set itself
A value set with only one import SHALL also have an include and/or an exclude unless the value set includes and inline code system

fhir:xpath.value: not(exists(f:compose)) or (count(f:compose/f:import)!=1 or exists(f:compose/f:include) or exists(f:compose/f:exclude) or exists(f:codeSystem))

fhir:human.value: Value set SHALL contain at least one of a codeSystem, a compose, or an expansion element

fhir:short.value: Globally unique logical id for value set

fhir:definition.value: An absolute URL that is used to identify this value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this value set is (or will be) published.

fhir:short.value: Additional identifier for the value set (v2 / CDA)

fhir:definition.value: Formal identifier that is used to identify this value set when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

fhir:short.value: Logical id for this version of the value set

fhir:definition.value: Used to identify this version of the value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the profile author manually and the value should be a timestamp.

fhir:short.value: Informal name for this value set

fhir:definition.value: A free text natural language name describing the value set.

fhir:short.value: draft | active | retired

fhir:definition.value: The status of the value set.

fhir:requirements.value: Identify when/if the value set should be used.

fhir:description.value: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map

fhir:short.value: If for testing purposes, not real usage

fhir:definition.value: This valueset was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

fhir:short.value: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)

fhir:definition.value: The name of the individual or organization that published the value set.

fhir:requirements.value: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the value set. May also allow for contact.

fhir:short.value: Contact details of the publisher

fhir:definition.value: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

fhir:short.value: Name of a individual to contact

fhir:definition.value: The name of an individual to contact regarding the value set.

fhir:short.value: Contact details for individual or publisher

fhir:definition.value: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

fhir:short.value: Date for given status

fhir:definition.value: The date that the value set status was last changed. The date must change when the business version changes, if it does, and it must change if the status code changes. in addition, it should change when the substantiative content of the implementation guide changes (e.g. the 'content logical definition').

fhir:requirements.value: Need to know when a value set was first legal for use or became withdrawn or replaced.

fhir:short.value: Fixed date for all referenced code systems and value sets

fhir:definition.value: If a Locked Date is defined, then the Content Logical Definition must be evaluated using the current version of all referenced code system(s) and value sets as of the Locked Date.

fhir:short.value: Human language description of the value set

fhir:definition.value: A free text natural language description of the use of the value set - reason for definition, "the semantic space" to be included in the value set, conditions of use, etc. The description may include a list of expected usages for the value set and can also describe the approach taken to build the value set.

fhir:short.value: Content intends to support these contexts

fhir:definition.value: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching of value set definitions.

fhir:requirements.value: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

fhir:description.value: Indicates the countries, regions, disciplines and other aspects of use this artifact is targeted for use within

fhir:short.value: Indicates whether or not any change to the content logical definition may occur

fhir:definition.value: If this is set to 'true', then no new versions of the content logical definition can be created. Note: Other metadata might still change.

fhir:short.value: Why is this needed?

fhir:definition.value: Explains why this value set is needed and why it's been constrained as it has.

fhir:short.value: Use and/or Publishing restrictions

fhir:definition.value: A copyright statement relating to the value set and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the value set.

fhir:short.value: Whether this is intended to be used with an extensible binding

fhir:definition.value: Whether this is intended to be used with an extensible binding or not.

fhir:requirements.value: It is not required to say whether this intent applies.

fhir:short.value: An inline code system - part of this value set

fhir:definition.value: A definition of an code system, inlined into the value set (as a packaging convenience). Note that the inline code system may be used from other value sets by referring to it's (codeSystem.system) directly.

fhir:human.value: Within a code system definition, all the codes SHALL be unique

fhir:short.value: URI to identify the code system (e.g. in Coding.system)

fhir:definition.value: An absolute URI that is used to reference this code system, including in [Coding]{datatypes.html#Coding}.system.

fhir:short.value: Version (for use in Coding.version)

fhir:definition.value: The version of this code system that defines the codes. Note that the version is optional because a well maintained code system does not suffer from versioning, and therefore the version does not need to be maintained. However many code systems are not well maintained, and the version needs to be defined and tracked.

fhir:short.value: If code comparison is case sensitive

fhir:definition.value: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.

fhir:short.value: Concepts in the code system

fhir:definition.value: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently heirarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meaning of the heirachical relationships are.

fhir:short.value: Code that identifies concept

fhir:definition.value: A code - a text symbol - that uniquely identifies the concept within the code system.

fhir:short.value: If this code is not for use as a real concept

fhir:definition.value: If this code is not for use as a real concept.

fhir:short.value: Text to Display to the user

fhir:definition.value: A human readable string that is the recommended default way to present this concept to a user.

fhir:short.value: Formal Definition

fhir:definition.value: The formal definition of the concept. The value set resource does not make formal definitions required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems. However, but they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the concept.

fhir:short.value: Additional representations for the concept

fhir:definition.value: Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

fhir:requirements.value: many concept definition systems support mltiple representations, in multiple languages, and for mltiple purposes.

fhir:short.value: Human language of the designation

fhir:definition.value: The language this designation is defined for.

fhir:short.value: Details how this designation would be used

fhir:definition.value: A code that details how this designation would be used.

fhir:description.value: Details of how a designation would be used

fhir:short.value: The text value for this designation

fhir:definition.value: The text value for this designation.

fhir:short.value: Child Concepts (is-a / contains / categorises)

fhir:definition.value: Child Concepts - a heirarchy of concepts. The nature of the relationships is variable (is-a / contains / categorises) and can only be determined by examining the definitions of the concepts.

fhir:short.value: When value set includes codes from elsewhere

fhir:definition.value: A set of criteria that provide the content logical definition of the value set by including or excluding codes from outside this value set.

fhir:human.value: A value set composition SHALL have an include or an import

fhir:short.value: Import the contents of another value set

fhir:definition.value: Includes the contents of the referenced value set as a part of the contents of this value set. This is an absolute URI that is a reference to ValueSet.uri.

fhir:short.value: Include one or more codes from a code system

fhir:definition.value: Include one or more codes from a code system.

fhir:human.value: Cannot have both concept and filter

fhir:short.value: The system the codes come from

fhir:definition.value: An absolute URI which is the code system from which the selected codes come from.

fhir:short.value: Specific version of the code system referred to

fhir:definition.value: The version of the code system that the codes are selected from.

fhir:short.value: A concept defined in the system

fhir:definition.value: Specifies a concept to be included or excluded.

fhir:short.value: Code or expression from system

fhir:definition.value: Specifies a code for the concept to be included or excluded.

fhir:short.value: Test to display for this code for this value set

fhir:definition.value: The text to display to the user for this concept in the context of this valueset. If no display is provided, then applications using the value set use the display specified for the code by the system.

fhir:short.value: Additional representations for this valueset

fhir:definition.value: Additional representations for this concept when used in this value set - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

fhir:short.value: Select codes/concepts by their properties (including relationships)

fhir:definition.value: Select concepts by specify a matching criteria based on the properties (including relationships) defined by the system. If multiple filters are specified, they SHALL all be true.

fhir:short.value: A property defined by the code system

fhir:definition.value: A code that identifies a property defined in the code system.

fhir:short.value: = | is-a | is-not-a | regex | in | not-in

fhir:definition.value: The kind of operation to perform as a part of the filter criteria.

fhir:description.value: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter

fhir:short.value: Code from the system, or regex criteria

fhir:definition.value: The match value may be either a code defined by the system, or a string value which is used a regex match on the literal string of the property value.

fhir:short.value: Explicitly exclude codes

fhir:definition.value: Exclude one or more codes from the value set.

fhir:short.value: The system the codes come from

fhir:definition.value: An absolute URI which is the code system from which the selected codes come from.

fhir:short.value: Specific version of the code system referred to

fhir:definition.value: The version of the code system that the codes are selected from.

fhir:short.value: A concept defined in the system

fhir:definition.value: Specifies a concept to be included or excluded.

fhir:short.value: Code or expression from system

fhir:definition.value: Specifies a code for the concept to be included or excluded.

fhir:short.value: Test to display for this code for this value set

fhir:definition.value: The text to display to the user for this concept in the context of this valueset. If no display is provided, then applications using the value set use the display specified for the code by the system.

fhir:short.value: Additional representations for this valueset

fhir:definition.value: Additional representations for this concept when used in this value set - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

fhir:short.value: Select codes/concepts by their properties (including relationships)

fhir:definition.value: Select concepts by specify a matching criteria based on the properties (including relationships) defined by the system. If multiple filters are specified, they SHALL all be true.

fhir:short.value: A property defined by the code system

fhir:definition.value: A code that identifies a property defined in the code system.

fhir:short.value: = | is-a | is-not-a | regex | in | not-in

fhir:definition.value: The kind of operation to perform as a part of the filter criteria.

fhir:description.value: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter

fhir:short.value: Code from the system, or regex criteria

fhir:definition.value: The match value may be either a code defined by the system, or a string value which is used a regex match on the literal string of the property value.

fhir:short.value: Used when the value set is "expanded"

fhir:definition.value: A value set can also be "expanded", where the value set is turned into a simple collection of enumerated codes. This element holds the expansion, if it has been performed.

fhir:short.value: Uniquely identifies this expansion

fhir:definition.value: An identifier that uniquely identifies this expansion of the valueset. Systems may re-use the same identifier as long as the expansion and the definition remain the same, but are not required to do so.

fhir:short.value: Time valueset expansion happened

fhir:definition.value: The time at which the expansion was produced by the expanding system.

fhir:short.value: Total number of codes in the expansion

fhir:definition.value: The total nober of concepts in the expansion. If the number of concept nodes in this resource is less than the stated number, then the server can return more using the offset parameter.

fhir:short.value: Offset at which this resource starts

fhir:definition.value: If paging is being used, the offset at which this resource starts - e.g. this resource is a partial view into the expansion. If paging is not being used, this element SHALL not be present.

fhir:short.value: Parameter that controlled the expansion process

fhir:definition.value: A Parameter that controlled the expansion process. These parameters may be used by users of expanded value sets to check whether the expansion is suitable for a particular purpose, or to pick the correct expansion.

fhir:short.value: Name as assigned by server

fhir:definition.value: The name of the parameter.

fhir:short.value: Value of the named parameter

fhir:definition.value: The value of the parameter.

fhir:short.value: Codes in the value set

fhir:definition.value: The codes that are contained in the value set expansion.

fhir:human.value: SHALL have a code or a display
Must have a code if not abstract
Must have a system if a code is present

fhir:short.value: System value for the code

fhir:definition.value: An absolute URI which is the code system in which the code for this item in the expansion is defined.

fhir:short.value: If user cannot select this entry

fhir:definition.value: If true, this entry is included in the expansion for navigational purposes, and the user cannot select the code directly as a proper value.

fhir:short.value: Version in which this code / display is defined

fhir:definition.value: The version of this code system that defined this code and/or display. This should only be used with code systems that do not enforce concept permanence.

fhir:short.value: Code - if blank, this is not a choosable code

fhir:definition.value: The code for this item in the expansion heirarchy. If this code is missing the entry in the heirarchy is a place holder (abstract) and doesn't represent a valid code in the value set.

fhir:short.value: User display for the concept

fhir:definition.value: The recommended display for this item in the expansion.

fhir:short.value: Codes contained under this entry

fhir:definition.value: Other codes and entries contained under this entry in the heirarchy.
